newsitem.title: USA: Echo Bay CEO sees gold price at $375.
newsitem.headline: Echo Bay CEO sees gold price at $375.

text.p: Gold producers can expect the price of gold to stay near $375 per ounce, Echo Bay Mines Chief Executive Officer Richard Kraus said.
"Gold mining companies must make investment decisions and make money with the price at $375," Kraus told the National Western Mining Conference here.
He said the gold deficit of between 20-30 million ounces a year is being made up by central bank selling, which he called "the defining issue that overhangs the gold market today."
Kraus told Reuters later he expects continued consolidation in the mining industry, but that current economics rather than the price of gold are responsible.
He said companies have to be bigger to compete on a global scale.
Kraus told the conference Echo Bay looks for properties with a long life than can produce gold at between $300-$325 an ounce.
Alliances are key, he said. "We believe strongly" in forging alliances and partnerships, he said, noting that small companies are good at finding gold.
